ai.summary: A 10.4 km circular hike around the Erewash area in the UK. Classified as moderate, this route blends rural fields, woodlands and occasional minor road sections, suitable for walkers with some experience and good fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly mixed-terrain with well-kept footpaths, grassy tracks and compacted earth. Expect possible mud after rain, occasional stiles or gates, and gentle gradients. Views of the surrounding countryside throughout the loop.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast and be prepared for changes in weather. Wear sturdy boots and dress in layers. Carry water and snacks, a map or GPS, and a charged phone. Stay on marked paths, respect livestock and private land, and close gates behind you. Let someone know your route and expected return time. Plan for shorter daylight in winter and carry a light if necessary.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good traction
Map or GPS device (and a charged phone)
Headlamp or flashlight (if walking near dusk)
Backpack with enough capacity for gear and supplies
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) for the best conditions and scenery; winter walks are possible with proper gear and shorter daylight.

seo.title: Erewash Circular Walk 5 – 10.4 km Moderate UK Hike
seo.meta_description: Discover Erewash Circular Walk 5, a 10.4 km moderate hike in the UK. Mixed terrain, rural scenery, safety tips, and gear recommendations for a comfortable countryside loop.
